newsitem.title: SOUTH AFRICA: Usko busy, touches new year high.
newsitem.headline: Usko busy, touches new year high.

text.p: South African copper products and conductors firm Usko Ltd saw heavy dealings at the start of trade on Thursday on follow-through interest after a recent deal selling a stake in the firm.

The firm's shares touched a new year high of 70 cents, before falling back to 69 cents, up five cents on the day by 0835 GMT. Volumes of over 1.18 million shares made it the busiest stock on the bourse.
"There's no new material reason for the interest. It is just follow through from the Metkor deal," one dealer said.

Last week Metkor Group Ltd sold its 27.3 percent stake in the firm to funds under the management of Capital Partners Ltd, Fedsure Asset Management, Genbel Securities Ltd and John Beck for 38 cents a share cash, with effect from May 30.
Dealers said there was a market perception that the deal may have been done at too low a price. "My feeling is they sold too cheaply," one dealer said.
